result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrice Dwayne Hood

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood appeared by video.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Montrice Dwayne Hood.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of 22CF774.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Heather Sandler -    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-12-22

Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood appeared by video.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg appeared by video for Montrice Dwayne Hood.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Unable to proceed due to court congestion. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Montrice Dwayne Hood.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing.  Defendant withdraws bail/bond hearing; posted bail on August 24, 2022.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 1:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or use of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
No driving. 
Defendant was taken into custody.

Defendant Montrice Dwayne Hood in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Montrice Dwayne Hood.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
